flow.descriptionCdata:
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.0ccb6c45-a9b1-4ca2-becf-10110f24a8f9.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.0f31b0bd-6dd5-4a3a-9d58-0c66587da753.transition.description=Start NicBonding_Script (3 NICs) 1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.0fbbe38a-8b46-4f9c-bf0c-46631698bafb.transition.description=SA_StartAdHocScriptDirect - Set gateway 1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.305f31c2-0153-440a-bd30-add9e859fd3d.description=
This operation adds a flow variable to the local context. The variable is available in the current flow and its child flows.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The name of the flow variable to add.
    myValue - The value to assign to the flow variable.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of "myValue" input field.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.

Note\:
   If a flow variable with the same name already exists, its value will be overwritten.
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.3a534bb8-7fa0-4299-93e4-94872fabe805.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.3e8ac88e-73c8-4d4e-9c2d-1fcefa0f896a.transition.description=setHostsFile 1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.3faaab5e-21ad-4536-a6db-367fcc79aeb9.description=
Sends an smtp email
 
Input Parameters\:
hostname - hostname or ip address of smtp server
port - port smtp service is listening
from - from email address
to - email address(s) or recipients
subject - email subject
body - body of the email
htmlEmail - true or false, whether the email should be sent supporting html rich email.
readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.46991179-0730-451d-a679-ac7a00f21c26.description=
Useful Op to keep a running results.
Takes a string input (resultText) and appends this to a global context key of "runningResults". As a result, the context key whose name is in the keyName input will be appended with the string from the input resultText.

Input Parameters\:
keyName - name of context key to append to
resultText - string input to append
delimiter - (leave blank for none) the delimiter to put between what is already in keyName before appending resultText

Responses\:
success - assigned the context variable

Returns\:
The the value of the context variable it appended to.

Context\:
runningResults

Scriptlet Example\:
currentResults \= scriptletContext.get("runningResults");

if (currentResults \=\= null) {
   currentResults \= resultText;
} else {
   currentResults +\= resultText;
}


scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.4f571f24-e78c-4fd4-b138-875fd940e4db.description=
Sends an smtp email

readReceipt - true or false, whether or not to request a read receipt
attachments - comma separated list of files to attach (must be full path)
username - if SMTP authentication is needed, the username to send
password - the password to use
characterSet - the character set encoding for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is UTF-8
contentTransferEncoding - the content transfer encoding scheme (such as 7bit, 8bit, base64, quoted-printable etc) for the entire email which includes subject, body, attached file name and the attached file. Default value is - quoted-printable or Q Encoding.
 
 Responses\:
 success - successfully sent the email
 failure - failed to send the email

Note\:
For special characters (East Asian, right-to-left languages, etc.) you must install the support files on your local machine.
	For doing this on Windows go to Control Panel -> Regional and Language Options -> Language and check the options at Supplemental language support.

Scriptlet Example\:

scriptletContext.putGlobal("runningResults", currentResults);
1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.92fa7c00-72ca-4465-8ef1-062d19adc6f9.description=

If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

false - If the two strings are not equal

1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.a53f8e1e-1e35-4e12-a1f0-1c64e1387020.description=Inputs\: script.code - The source code of the script to invoke. script.type - The type of the source code. It can have one of the following values\: SH (for unix scripts), BAT (for windows BAT scripts), VBS (for Windows Visual Basic scripts), PS1 (for Windows PowerShell scripts), PY2 (for Python scripts). script.args - The arguments to be passed to the script. server.name true - The list of names of the managed server on which the script should be executed. The elements from the list should be separated by ','. 1669ee3c-272d-40cd-a8ca-557d627fae47.aafdc2f6-2d30-44f9-a4df-2dc44eccd8d2.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal

Useful Op to keep a running results.

flow.name: LINUX_NetConfig

staticBinding.value: eth0 eth1 ${server.ip.backup} ${pc.backupvlan.subnetmask} bond0 eth2 eth3 ${server.ip.primary} ${subnet_mask_IP1} bond1 eth4 eth5 ${server.ip.secondary} ${subnet_mask_IP2} bond2

Something went wrong with ${RS_Previous_Transition_Annotation}. Please verify what failed and if something should be done to correct it.

Hostname: ${server.hostname}
Flow: LINUX_NetConfig (in pc_post_deploy_linux)

One or more steps failed, but the flow continued regardless. Please check if the failures need manual actions to fix.

failures: ${failures}

Hostname: ${server.hostname}
Flow: LINUX_NetConfig (in pc_post_deploy_linux)

#!/bin/bash
PROD_NAME="bond1" PROD_IP="${server.ip.primary}" PROD_MASK="${subnet_mask_IP1}" PROD_GATEWAY="${server.gateway}"
REDHAT_PATH2ETH=/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts #REDHAT_ROUTE_FILE=/etc/sysconfig/network REDHAT_ROUTE_FILE=/etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/route-$PROD_NAME SUSE_PATH2ETH=/etc/sysconfig/network SUSE_ROUTE_FILE=$SUSE_PATH2ETH/routes SUSE=1 REDHAT=0 OSTYPE=$SUSE
function detect_distribution() { # check if the running system a SUSE or a Redhat distribution local redhat_release=/etc/redhat-release local suse_release=/etc/SuSE-release
if [ -f $redhat_release ]; then OSTYPE=$REDHAT fi if [ -f $suse_release ]; then OSTYPE=$SUSE fi }
detect_distribution
if [ $OSTYPE -eq $SUSE ]; then PATH2ETH=$SUSE_PATH2ETH else PATH2ETH=$REDHAT_PATH2ETH fi
echo $PATH2ETH
if [ $OSTYPE -eq $SUSE ]; then rm -f /etc/sysconfig/network/ifcfg-eth-id-* if [ "$PROD_IP" ]; then echo "Setting default route to gateway: "$PROD_GATEWAY echo "default $PROD_GATEWAY - $PROD_NAME" >> $SUSE_ROUTE_FILE fi fi
if [ $OSTYPE -eq $REDHAT ]; then if [ "$PROD_IP" ]; then echo "Setting default route to gateway: "$PROD_GATEWAY #sed -i -e "/^GATEWAY=/d" -e "/^HOSTNAME=/a GATEWAY=$PROD_GATEWAY" $REDHAT_ROUTE_FILE echo "default via $PROD_GATEWAY" > $REDHAT_ROUTE_FILE fi fi
/etc/init.d/network restart
if [ $OSTYPE -eq $REDHAT ]; then /etc/init.d/ntpd restart fi
if [ $OSTYPE -eq $SUSE ]; then /etc/init.d/ntp restart fi
if [ -f /opt/opsware/agent/pylibs/cog/bs_hardware ]; then /opt/opsware/agent/pylibs/cog/bs_hardware --force --debug > /var/tmp/opsware_register.log if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "!! ERROR: Error occurs when trying to regist the target server with SA" echo "" exit 2 fi fi

Something went wrong with ${RS_Previous_Transition_Annotation}, but the flow is marked as successful. Please verify what failed and if something should be done to correct it.

Hostname: ${server.hostname}
Flow: LINUX_NetConfig (in pc_post_deploy_linux)
eth0 eth1 ${server.ip.backup} ${pc.backupvlan.subnetmask} bond0 eth2 eth3 ${server.ip.primary} ${subnet_mask_IP1} bond1
